edu.biu.protocols.CommitmentWithZkProofOfDifference

Class SCom

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.protocols.CommitmentWithZkProofOfDifference.SCom
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class SCom
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents one commitment in the difference protocol.

    Each commitment contains commitment message on the random value r and the xor of r and the message x.

    It also contain the decommitments of the above commitments.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Asaf Cohen)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SCom(CmtCommitter committer, byte[] x, byte[] r, long id)
      A constructor that computes the commitment and decommitment messages of x xor r and r.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CmtCCommitmentMsg getC0()
      Returns the commitment message of x^r.
      CmtCCommitmentMsg getC1()
      Returns the commitment message of r.
      CmtCDecommitmentMessage getDecom(int i)
      Returns the decommitment message of r or x^r according to the given index.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SCom

        public SCom(CmtCommitter committer,
            byte[] x,
            byte[] r,
            long id)
     throws CommitValueException
        A constructor that computes the commitment and decommitment messages of x xor r and r.
        Parameters:
        committer - Used to commit and decommit the values.
        x - The actual value to commit on.
        r - The random value used to commit.
        id - The first id to use in the commitment.
        Throws:
        CommitValueException - if the given committer cannot commit on a byte[].

        Returns the commitment message of r.

      • getDecom

        public CmtCDecommitmentMessage getDecom(int i)
        Returns the decommitment message of r or x^r according to the given index.
        Parameters:
        i - Indicates which decommitment to return.
